titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the B.A.N.G. Notes newsletters BCMS.0091
titlestmt.author: Alice Griffin, Archivist

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-18 19:48:51 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection contains issues of B.A.N.G. Notes, the newsletter of the Brooklyn Anti-Nuclear Group (BANG), which ran from 1981 to 1986.
did.physloc: The majority of the materials in this collection are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact cbhreference@bklynlibrary.org at least two weeks prior to research visit.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jennifer Hoyer on behalf of the Interference Archive, 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Anti-Nuclear Group (BANG) formed in 1978 as an anti-nuclear power, anti-nuclear weapons, anti-racist, anti-sexist, anti-exploitation group.

The first B.A.N.G. Notes newsletter was released in January 1981 to notify people of BANG's rate withholding campaign against Con Edison's rate increases after a leak at the Indian Point nuclear power plant, and other demonstrations and events. The newsletter was initially sent to rate withholders, left in stores around Brooklyn, and accepted donations to contribute to publication and distribution costs. The last issue was released in early 1986.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The majority of the materials in this collection are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact cbhreference@bklynlibrary.org at least two weeks prior to research visit.
If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); B.A.N.G Notes newsletters, BCMS.0091, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Center for Brooklyn History holds the following related collections:
The Peace Collection at Swarthmore College holds issues of B.A.N.G. Notes, 1982-1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues of B.A.N.G. Notes: The Newsletter of the Brooklyn Anti-Nuclear Group, 1981-1986. The collection includes the first and last issues, but is an incomplete run with some duplicates. The content of these newsletters includes information about nuclear disarmament and anti-nuclear power campaigns, as well as notices and articles about related movements, such as the anti-draft movement and the American Indian Movement, especially related to land sovereignty issues. B.A.N.G. Notes also published poems, letters, opinion pieces, and cartoons.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These newsletters were originally given to Interference Archive as part of a larger collection by Bob McGlynn, date unknown.
